text: Nidara pumilla is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Watson in 1965. It is found in Madagascar.Afro Moths The length of the forewings is about 11.5 mm. The forewings are yellow, lightly speckled with pale reddish brown and with a small whitish spot edged with brown close to the cell. The hindwings are yellow.A revision of the Ethiopian Drepanidae (Lepidoptera) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1965 Category:Drepaninae
title: Nidara pumilla
